Name: Amber Room
Ingredients: 15 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
10 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist (discarded) & Luxardo Maraschino Cherry .
Review: Serious and packed with bold flavours. Fellow Chartreuse fans will approve.
History: This vintage cocktail originated from a layered or 'pousse-café' style drink called a Bijou. The original drink was so named after the French word meaning 'jewel' due to its trio of ingredients being coloured after the three most precious jewels: diamond (gin), ruby (sweet vermouth) and emerald (Green Chartreuse). Stir rather than layer and the colours combine to make this an aptly named amber coloured drink.
Nutrition: One serving of Amber Room contains 175 calories
